question: 分解
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: Take all the separate <kanji>part</kanji>s. Now <kanji>untie</kanji> them, unraveling the connections between the two parts. In this way we can do a <vocabulary>breakdown</vocabulary>. We're <vocabulary>dismantling</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>disassembling</vocabulary> something.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
